name: SAF Introduction
headline: SAF Platform
text:
[Strategic Alternative Funds (SAF) Platform](https://safplatform.com) is a financial-technology company in New York City, focusing on making the trading of alternative funds—private equity, hedge funds, derivatives, etc.—easier through technology. SAF, working directly with key industry partners, helps remove many of the bottlenecks and regulatory paperwork headaches by creating a platform that not only walks you through the process of buying and trading these funds, but also sets your team up to be 100% digital.

When SAF came to us in 2015, they had designs for every single view of their app (over 1,000 pages!) but needed help turning those Sketch documents into a functioning prototype. Leveraging our experience at StubHub, we demonstrated and ultimately convinced SAF to instead take a component systems approach, which would not only allow for faster, more-robust development, but also would give us the potential to reuse prototype code in the final product.

Working with an Angular.js developer in Barcelona, we created roughly 15 components (which were eventually turned into Angular Directives), along with a typography system and color palette. With these pieces, we were then able to create demo pages for each component, as well as representations of the original design pages. We worked together with SAF designers to create a tight feedback loop to address any bugs or design updates before they were handed off.

Along with our component library, we assisted in the creation of a Sketch style guide document, which outlined the design documentation, rules, and measurements of every component. This allowed additional designers to easily pick the system up, and allowed developers to be precise in their code.

- **Client**: Strategic Alternative Funds (SAF)
- **Technology**: Angular.js (v1), Sass (SCSS), HTML5, Bootstrap, Gulp, Jekyll
- **Responsibilities**: Component Library Development, Prototyping, Testing & QA
- **Code**: [GitHub](https://github.com/alexiscordova/saf)
